solver

@author Lee Avital

Holds various functions used for generating and evaluating scrabble moves

T[V] set_union(T, V)(T[V] a, T[V] b);
find the union of two hash sets

Ideally, the first parameter is larger but it will work both ways

void solve(Board b, TrieNode d, Rack r);
solve @param b the board to solve @param d the first node in a DAWG that holds all valid words @param r the rack

int evaluateMove(Board b, Move m);
evaluate a move and return the number of points scored

@param b the board on which the move is played @param m the move to be evaluated

bool checkCrossSet(char c, Position anchor);
check to see if a given character is in a positions cross set i.e. , if A is the word above and B is below, is AcB a word?

@param c the character to check @param anchor the position at which to check
